lexUnit.name: hurl.v
lexUnit.definition: COD: throw or impel with great force

sentence.text: JUST AS THE PANTING CYCLIST drew ahead of the London to St Alban 's coach the guard hurled an iron ball on a rope into the spokes of the bicycle wheel and felled the rider .
There was a new NI record for North Down 's Alison Moffitt , who hurled the javelin 47.54 metres and she later made it a double by throwing the discus 39.72 metres .
AN animal rights activist who hurled a smoke bomb across the counter of a burger bar was yesterday banned from all McDonald 's restaurants .
In the presence of a few hundred Masai , the young warrior hurled his spear right through the district officer 's heart .
Two fiesty little Yorkshire terriers leap off his lap and hurl their combined body weight of two grapefruits against my legs .
The gaunt woman hurled his plastic pistol after him .
At last he sat back , tousled and infuriated , crumpled the cheque and hurled it across the room .
Dashwood let out a howl of frustration and hurled Farrell across the room .
He hurled a chair across the set , smashing lamps and vases , then stormed off to his dressing room .
He suddenly grabbed the beer can and hurled it against the wall then upturned the table , sending it crashing against the cooker .
I followed them onto a narrow , crumbling ledge above the ravine where the wind hurled us against the wall .
For several months intermittent Vulcanian activity continued , hurling ash between four and eight kilometres in the air , but died down somewhat in early 1956 .
Horrocks pulled the silver cross from his chest and hurled it from him .
A SHOPKEEPER was fighting for his life in hospital last night after a gas blast hurled him from his bed into the street .
All around him people were hurling possessions from windows and dragging horses from smoking stables .
Speechless with rage , Mait hurled the card in the Doctor 's face before storming out of the cell .
C'zinsit hurled himself into the saddle and charged away .
Financiers would not hurl themselves off City window-sills .
Ellen hurled the still discharging extinguisher over the side .
A bolt thrower is a powerful weapon which can hurl its bolt through several ranks of troops , piercing each warrior in turn .
The tank blew up , hurling the Vauxhall through the closed garage doors , which caused twenty more gallons of petrol to explode , blowing the front off the house .
David Gower survives a caught-behind appeal off Mushtaq , provoking substitute Rashid Latif ( centre , in cap ) into a dash down the length of the pitch , where he hurled his cap to the ground .
Then , when the boy was n't looking in his direction he hurled it towards the pool .
He hurled himself at the boy .
They hurled potatoes at firemen trying to douse a bonfire of tyres in the town 's central square , prompting riot police to fire tear gas .
Jake had been hurling these same insults at her now for years , and by now she ought to be totally immune to them .
With a triumphant yell , she hurled the harpoon .
He feinted once , then , with great speed and strength behind the throw , hurled the spear .
Some began to hurl stones .
Fights frequently broke out in the course of which gilt chairs got hurled across the room .
Simon Lilley was hurled more than seventy feet by the impact and later died in hospital .
He shut the kitchen door smartly to avoid the dishcloth that was hurled in his direction .
The back seat , its padding springing from the slashed plastic , had been ripped out and hurled to one side .
Earlier this month Mr Cossiga publicly hurled the epithet “ son of a … ” at a British journalist who described Italy 's military contribution to the Gulf war as a “ token force ” .
` I hurled my shirt down because I was so angry -- I felt cheated .
A few cowlings and panels got bent though , having been lifted off the floor and hurled against the hangar wall by the force of the propeller .
A poem for Lucy was a message in a bottle hurled into a turquoise ocean .
They were hurled up like waves breaking backwards into the sea .
He had gone only a few yards however when the horse hurled him over a precipice to his death .
